info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:22PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Nottoway, northwestern Dinwiddie and southeastern Amelia Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 121 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Pickett, or near Blackstone, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wilsons around 155 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Wellville, North Wellville, Dominy Corner, Walkers, Hebron, Ammon, Rocky Run, Forkland, Ford and Blackstone Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
